Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 11

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 11

Master these intermediate words commonly used in academic writing and professional communication.

Navigation

This is page 11 of 15. Use the navigation below to explore all vocabulary pages.

Word List

History

/ˈhɪstəri/

noun

The study of past events, particularly in human affairs.

"She majored in history and became a museum curator."

Synonyms: past, chronicle, record

Category: Time

Identity

/aɪˈdentəti/

noun

The fact of being who or what a person or thing is.

"Cultural identity plays an important role in personal development."

Synonyms: character, personality, individuality

Category: Self

Importance

/ɪmˈpɔːrtəns/

noun

The quality or state of being important; significance.

"The importance of education cannot be overstated."

Synonyms: significance, value, weight

Category: Value

Include

/ɪnˈkluːd/

verb

To comprise or contain as a part of a whole.

"The package includes breakfast and dinner."

Synonyms: contain, encompass, involve

Category: Inclusion

Increase

/ɪnˈkriːs/

verb, noun

To become or make greater in size, amount, intensity, or degree.

"There has been an increase in online shopping this year."

Synonyms: grow, rise, expand

Category: Growth

Individual

/ˌɪndəˈvɪdʒuəl/

adjective, noun

Single; separate; a single human being as distinct from a group.

"Each individual has their own unique talents and abilities."

Synonyms: person, single, separate

Category: Person

Industry

/ˈɪndəstri/

noun

Economic activity concerned with the processing of raw materials and manufacture of goods.

"The technology industry has created many new job opportunities."

Synonyms: business, sector, field

Category: Business

Information

/ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən/

noun

Facts provided or learned about something or someone.

"The internet provides access to vast amounts of information."

Synonyms: data, knowledge, details

Category: Knowledge

Institution

/ˌɪnstəˈtuːʃən/

noun

An established organization, especially one dedicated to education, public service, or culture.

"The university is a respected educational institution."

Synonyms: organization, establishment, foundation

Category: Organization

Involve

/ɪnˈvɑːlv/

verb

To include someone or something as a necessary part or result.

"The project will involve collaboration between multiple departments."

Synonyms: include, require, entail

Category: Participation

Issue

/ˈɪʃuː/

noun, verb

An important topic or problem for debate or discussion.

"Climate change is a major issue facing our planet."

Synonyms: problem, matter, concern

Category: Problem

Knowledge

/ˈnɑːlɪdʒ/

noun

Facts, information, and skills acquired by a person through experience or education.

"Her knowledge of computers helped her get the job."

Synonyms: understanding, expertise, learning

Category: Learning
